sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure (Network, DB, CI) and core service data models.
epic_coverage: Platform Foundation & DevOps,Identity & Access Service,Order Management Service,Vendor & Catalog Service
key_deliverables: Isolated VPCs for all environments, a provisioned Multi-AZ RDS database, a functioning CI pipeline, and core data models for Users, Orders, and Products.
demo_objectives: Show Terraform code provisioning a VPC and RDS instance. Demonstrate a CI pipeline running on a sample service.
success_criteria: All infrastructure provisioned in dev environment. CI pipeline passes for all initial service skeletons. Data models are finalized and reviewed.
risk_factors: Complexity of Terraform modules for a new team, potential IAM permission issues.
mitigation_strategies: Assign senior DevOps lead to critical infra tasks, conduct extensive peer reviews on Terraform code.

sprint_goal: Provision compute platform (EKS), automate CD, and deploy the Identity service.
epic_coverage: Platform Foundation & DevOps,Identity & Access Service,Order Management Service
key_deliverables: A functioning EKS cluster, a full CI/CD pipeline to staging, a deployed Identity & Access Service with OTP login and RBAC.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate a code merge to `main` automatically deploying the Identity service to staging. Show a successful OTP login flow via an API client.
success_criteria: Identity service is live and tested in staging. CD pipeline successfully deploys a change. OTP login meets security and performance requirements.
risk_factors: RISK-007 (Infrastructure Delays), RISK-004 (Security Vulnerability in Auth), RISK-005 (Team Expertise). EKS and CD pipeline complexity.
mitigation_strategies: Prioritize DevOps work, conduct mandatory security reviews for auth code, provide training resources for EKS.
integration_windows: End-to-end testing of Identity service in staging environment on days 8-9.
burndown_target: Linear burndown, with EKS provisioned by day 6.

sprint_goal: Implement core commerce logic: resilient checkout saga, bulk product import, and platform observability.
epic_coverage: Platform Foundation & DevOps,Order Management Service,Vendor & Catalog Service
key_deliverables: A fully functional Observability stack (Prometheus, Grafana). The backend implementation of the Checkout Saga. The backend workflow for CSV product import.
demo_objectives: Show a Grafana dashboard with metrics from deployed services. Demonstrate the event flow of a successful checkout saga via logs/traces. Show a CSV import being processed asynchronously.
success_criteria: Checkout Saga passes all integration tests for success and failure paths. Bulk import correctly processes valid CSVs and generates error reports. Basic alerts are firing correctly.
risk_factors: RISK-002 (Saga Failure), RISK-006 (Testing Complexity). The technical complexity of both the Saga and the async CSV worker is very high.
mitigation_strategies: Allocate significant time for design review and pair programming on Saga and worker logic. Lower sprint utilization to provide buffer for complexity and extensive QA.
integration_windows: Integration testing for Saga and Import worker from day 5 onwards.
burndown_target: Focus on design validation in the first week, implementation in the second.
